Two positions at IoZ in London. Looks like there is scope for AI related people in at least one: Research Fellow: https://careers-zsl.icims.com/jobs/2489/research-fellow-in-conservation-science-%28full-time---permanent%29/job

careers
Research Fellow in Conservation Science (Full-Time / Permanent) in London, City of Westminster | Careers at London Zoo
We’re ZSL, an international conservation charity. Our vision is a world where wildlife thrives and we’re working every day to achieve this. From investigating the health threats facing animals, to helping people and wildlife live alongside each other, we are committed to bringing wildlife back from the brink of extinction. Through the work of our pioneering scientists, our dedicated conservationists and our unrivalled animal experts in our two zoos, we guide and enable others in the UK and all across the world. Inspiring, informing, empowering – working for wildlife.     
Original URL: https://careers-zsl.icims.com/jobs/2489/research-fellow-in-conservation-science-%28full-time---permanent%29/job
Heather Lynch (heather.lynch@stonybrook.edu)
2019-11-20 12:15:36

The Institute for Advanced Computational Sciences is advertising some new postdoctoral fellowships, which are open to any area of computationally-heavy science (including ecology). Fellows will be working with faculty but on any self-directed projected and will have a highly competitive salary as well as research funds. I am VERY much hoping to bring in a postdoc through this program interested in working at the interface of AI and ecology, either for computer vision and imagery (satellite, drone, camera trap), or for time series analysis. If you are interested and want more information or would like help assembling an application, please reach out to me soon because I am leaving for the field Dec 16 and will get back only a couple weeks before the Feb 1 deadline: https://iacs.stonybrook.edu/opportunities/fellowships/Postdoctoral-Fellowships

iacs.stonybrook.edu
Postdoctoral Fellowships | Institute for Advanced Computational Science
Postdoctoral fellowship opportunities listed here
Original URL: https://iacs.stonybrook.edu/opportunities/fellowships/Postdoctoral-Fellowships

Henrik Cox (Sentinel) (henrik@conservationxlabs.org)
2020-01-10 14:12:24

Hi all!   My name is Henrik Cox, I'm an engineer at Conservation X Labs, based in Washington D.C. The goal of our firm is to design and create new technologies to improve conservation efforts in eradicating human-induced extinction of wildlife globally.   I have recently posted our latest 2020 summer engineering internship. The program is geared toward students (undergraduate, graduate, and PhD) who are pursing studies in electrical engineering, embedded systems, and/or computer science.   If you know of any students, student groups, or faculty or university departments you believe would be interested in learning more, I have provided a link here: https://conservationxlabs.com/internships-1   Let me know if you have any further questions; we'd love to spread the word about this internship.   Cheers!

Conservation X Labs
2020 Engineering Internship — Conservation X Labs
Engineering internships
Original URL: https://conservationxlabs.com/internships-1

Kevin Winner (kevinwinner@gmail.com)
2020-03-26 11:43:28

Map of Life is looking for a data scientist for spatial distribution modeling:

Biodiversity Informatics Position at Yale Center for Biodiversity and Global Change - Map of Life     and the Yale Center for Biodiversity and Global Change is seeking a to join our growing team of developers and scientists at Yale University in New Haven, Connecticut.

Candidates should be interested in developing new technologies that will support effective global biodiversity education, monitoring, research and decision-making by assembling and integrating a wide range of knowledge about species distributions and their dynamics over time. The position will be based at Yale University, with close collaborative links to our partners worldwide. Please use to apply.

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values in our group. We aim to promote the success of traditionally underrepresented groups in science because we believe not only in the importance of increasing equity across academia, but also that a diverse team will enable a broader perspective and enhance creativity.

David Rolnick (dsrolnick@gmail.com)
2020-05-01 15:03:55

eButterfly is a participatory science program for tracking butterflies, covering observations in Canada and the United States as well as those in Mexico and Central America. Over 400,000 observations have been submitted, covering 705 species. The identification of species is currently validated by experts, but this validation presents a bottleneck and makes the identification process difficult to scale. To tackle this problem, Mila, a world-renowned Artificial Intelligence research institute and the Montreal Insectarium, the largest insect museum in North America, are working together to create an AI-powered image recognition tool for eButterfly.  As part of this project, they are offering a paid internship which will take place over 6 months, between May and December 2020. In order to apply, candidates must be a student of a Canadian university, with skills in Machine Learning (including computer vision and active/transfer learning) and an interest in species conservation and citizen science. They will be supervised by Sasha Luccioni, Mila's Director of Scientific Projects - AI for Humanity, and by Maxim Larrivée, director of the Montreal insectarium. To indicate your interest, please send your CV and a motivational letter/email to Sasha Luccioni (sasha.luccioni@mila.quebec).

Oisin Mac Aodha (macaodha@caltech.edu)
2020-05-04 06:14:30

Postdoctoral position to develop machine learning tools for bat species identification in audio recordings with USGS and Colorado State University.

We seek an outstanding early-career scientist to develop machine learning solutions in support of bat monitoring efforts based on the North American Bat Monitoring Program (NABat). The postdoc will develop machine learning algorithms to be used for species classification of bioacoustics and can be deployed through automated procedures on large holdings of acoustic data stored and accessed via cloud infrastructure. Results of classifications (species presence/absence) and estimates of uncertainty will be used in status and trends population models with environmental covariates that account for large-scale system changes. These models will be used to generate maps of species distributions and evaluate changes in of bat species in White-Nose Syndrome (WNS)-free regions. The outcome of this work will be to (1) establish baseline information to better understand the impacts of WNS and (2) improve efficiencies and scalability of acoustic data processing for NABat.

More info: https://jobs.colostate.edu/postings/77089 Deadline: May 24th 2020

🦇 Oisin Mac Aodha, Ben Weinstein

Heather Lynch (heather.lynch@stonybrook.edu)
2020-08-31 10:25:23

Unrelated to the above opportunity, I'm hiring two postdocs, not in AI per se but in related areas of Bayesian forecasting (there are also projects in AI that could be explored by the successful candidate):

The Lynch Lab at Stony Brook (http://lynchlab.com) has an opening for two postdoctoral researchers to begin as soon as possible. 

The successful applicants will work on several related projects involving Bayesian time series modelling of wildlife. One of these projects will involve the development of new Bayesian sampling algorithms for age-structured population models. In particular, we are working on methods to estimate survival and reproductive success using annual time series of total abundance across all aged breeders. A second project involves the continued development of population models for Antarctic wildlife, expanding a previous model developed for Adelie penguins (Che-Castaldo et al. 2017 Nature Communications) to three additional species: emperor penguins, Weddell seals, and crabeater seals. This latter project involves a highly interdisciplinary team of ecologists and sea ice modellers to understand inter-annual variability in the abundance of Antarctic penguins as well as their response to shifts in Antarctic climate. These models will be coupled with climate models to generate forecasts of abundance and distribution for these four Antarctic species. 

The successful applicant should have or will shortly obtain a PhD in the areas of quantitative ecology or applied math and statistics, or related areas such as computer science and electrical and computer engineering. This position is highly computational and requires a strong background in Python programming and Bayesian data analysis. Prior experience with high-performance computing, age-structured population models, reproducible research, and GitHub/version control, is desirable. 

Applications will be accepted until September 27, 2020. 

Questions: Email heather.lynch@stonybrook.edu Application link is here: https://bit.ly/3jwloKw

Lynch Lab
} hjlynch (https://lynchlab.com/author/hjlynch/)
Overview
The Lynch Lab is focused on applying quantitative methods to ecological questions in ecology and conservation biology. Although we work in a number of different areas related to quantitative ecology, central to my lab&rsquo;s current research activities are our efforts to understand the dynamics of ecological change on the Antarctic Peninsula and their genesis in environmental and anthropogenic drivers. For the very latest Lynch Lab news, check us out on Twitter and Instagram @TheLynchLab. Contact:Dr. Heather J. Lynch610 Life Sciences Bldg. Stony Brook University Stony Brook, NY 11794
Original URL: http://lynchlab.com
stonybrooku.taleo.net

Lily Xu (lily_xu@g.harvard.edu)
2020-11-01 16:34:38

Software Engineers -- Coding for Community Sustainability & Resilience

Community Hub (www.communityhub.cloud) is an Ohio-based tech startup with software currently in use by leading organizations in NE Ohio.  We seek resourceful and agile developers driven by a desire to build novel communications software that enhances environmental sustainability, equity, and community resilience in the face of a rapid climate change.  Hires must have the capacity to make rapid progress in further developing Environmental Dashboard -- a communications platform originally developed by Oberlin College faculty and students that includes: a data acquisition, processing, analysis, and display hub; digital signage display and control software; a novel crowd-sourced community calendar application; community-based social marketing software; and a phone app that integrates these components.  Problem solvers with demonstrated experience in server management, database management (SQL, Cassandra, and MongoDB), Symfony, and React and phone app development are highly desirable.  Visit www.communityhub.cloud/team for complete position description and application instructions.

🎉 Sara Beery, Elizabeth Bondi

Launching in Fall 2020, the initiative is designed to broaden collaborative opportunities across and beyond UBC for globally

Hannah Kerner (hkerner@umd.edu)
2020-11-18 12:08:56

Postdoc opening at ASU working with Asner Lab/Center for Global Discovery and Conservation Science on ML for underwater data science:

ASU-Paralenz Data Science Postdoctoral Research Scholar The Asner Lab of the Center for Global Discovery and Conservation Science (GDCS; gdcs.asu.edu) at Arizona State University (ASU), in partnership with Paralenz.com, seeks applications for a Postdoctoral Researcher in the area of Applied Data Science.  The successful applicant will work closely with GDCS scientists and Paralenz engineers developing digital AI-based approaches for the analysis of underwater video of coral reefs and fish. The position will link GDCS research and Paralenz engineering to advance a global community of diver-based underwater activities ranging from professional to citizen science, and from analytical research to public engagement.  Job Description GDCS is seeking to fill one Postdoctoral Researcher appointment for one year based in our main facility in Tempe, Arizona.  Research will focus on developing methods to automatically identify fish and other organisms in high-definition underwater video data.   Minimum Qualifications: • Received PhD within the last 3 years in Applied Data Science • Strong background in the application of objected-based deep learning algorithms (RCNN family or others).   • Programming language (i.e., Python, Julia) for implementation optional, but strong competency required. • Background in, or willingness to learn, web-hosted applications, including both front and backend development. • Familiarity with distributed computing environments, either cloud-based (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure), or cluster-based (SLURM / MPI), and willingness to transfer between the two. Essential Duties: • Develop digital AI-based approaches for the analysis of underwater video of coral reefs and fish

• Select appropriate models, assemble training datasets from raw data and apply models at the production level

Desired Qualifications: • Strong computer programming and spatial analysis demonstrated experience and skills

• Experience working with diverse collaborators and in a working group environment. • Willingness to learn about the ecology of reef ecosystems To apply, please submit the following as a single PDF document: to Andrea Cottrell (andrea.cottrell@asu.edu) with “UNDERWATER DATA SCIENCE Postdoc” as the subject line text. The filename for your PDF should be of the form _.pdf • A Statement of Research Interests (not to exceed 1 single-spaced page); • A resume or CV including a list of publications and the names/email address/phone numbers of three references

🙌 Sara Beery
Mathias Tobler (matobler@gmx.net)
2020-11-18 21:34:30

Our research group at the San Diego Zoo is looking for a Senior Research Associate to help with the development of data pipelines for our camera trap studies around the world and to help with our conservation technology lab. This is an entry-level position with a lot of potential to learn and grow.

Senior Research Associate – San Diego Zoo Global The Population Sustainability team is looking for a motivated Senior Research Associate to support our large-carnivore research programs and the Conservation Technology Lab. The successful candidate will help with the processing and management of large camera trap datasets from across the world, will write scripts and build data pipelines for efficiently importing and exporting camera trap data in different formats, will support our Zooniverse sites (AmazonCam Tambopata and Wildwatch Kenya), and will help with data analysis. The candidate will also support the Conservation Technology Lab in a variety of tasks from developing data pipelines for a variety of sensors, to building relational databases, training machine learning models, developing software for microcontrollers and single board computers, as well as helping out with hardware development and testing.

This position requires strong quantitative skills as well as proficiency in R and Python programming. A background in geographic information systems (GIS), C/C++ programming, relational databases, as well as occupancy and capture-recapture models are a plus. The position will be based at the Institute for Conservation Research in Escondido, CA. Experience and proficiency with Linux, Bash scripting, NumPy, SciPy, pandas, OpenCV and Git will be considered an asset.

More details can be found here: https://us59.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/sdzg/Posting/View/2317

🎉 Sara Beery
Frederic (frederic@apic.ai)
2020-11-24 08:07:31

We at apic.ai are looking for a full-time deep learning engineer, with an affinity for tiny insects and even smaller models. Help use save bees and shrink down CNNs models for the deployment on edge devices (Jetson Family).

If you are interested feel free to send me a DM (@Frederic or email frederic@apic.ai).

apic.ai is base in the southern part of Germany (Karlsruhe) and more details can be found here: https://apic.ai/jobs.html https://apic.ai/assets/pdf/2021-Vollzeit_DeepLearningEntwickler.pdf https://apic.ai/assets/pdf/2021-Vollzeit_EmbeddedComputerVisionEntwickler.pdf

We have free honey for everyone who shares the job posting (pick-up at our office)

Alayna Van Dervort (alaynavandervort@mac.com)
2020-12-03 14:10:39

@Alayna Van Dervort has joined the channel

Alayna Van Dervort (alaynavandervort@mac.com)
2020-12-03 14:14:39

The Big Wild is a growing tech for wildlife conservation start-up looking for a partner who has a full-stack engineer or similar background. We are looking to grow from a public benefit corp to having a 501c3 arm and we need a great team to help us set up the right way from the start. If you are passionate about wildlife conservation and are looking to help shape a company for large scale impact, then we are interested in speaking with you.

About The Big Wild: Saving critically endangered wildlife from extinction is at the heart of our mission. We aim to focus on collaboration for greater impact, partnering directly with Orgs that are working on Identifying wildlife either by creating new technology or Orgs that are in need of greater data sets, travel companies looking for extraordinary expedition packages that fight wildlife extinction, and conservation Orgs looking to utilize that data for conservation purpose on a grand scale.

The challenges are greater than ever, but with innovation, collaboration and community education The Big Wild aim's to give the experience of a lifetime while having the highest measurable impact in wildlife conservation.

Please reach out, send your interests and resume to : AV@TheBigWild.com https://thebigwild.com

thebigwild.com
The Big Wild Conservation Expeditions
We are excited to introduce The Big Wild, expeditions that fight wildlife extinction. When you join one of our journeys, you are choosing to travel not only with purpose but with innovation.
Original URL: https://thebigwild.com
Hannah Kerner (hkerner@umd.edu)
2020-12-16 00:13:03

From Dr. Katie Gold at Cornell: The application portal for the Cornell AgriTech Summer Scholars REU for Summer 2021 is now live! Our summer scholar program is a 9 week internship for undergraduates to do research with faculty at our AgriTech campus in plant pathology, entomology, and horticulture. We have tons of awesome projects ranging from 100% field, 100% lab, to 100% computation. Anticipated program start date is June 9th running through August 6th. Applications are due February 5th through the online portal. * * The REU is tentatively being planned for in person, but some projects, including all Gold Lab projects, can be conducted remotely if needed, with no preference given to in person applicants over remote applicants for eligible projects.   The Gold Lab (Grape Sensing, Pathology, and Extension at Cornell- GrapeSPEC) is recruiting 4 interns from diverse training backgrounds (viticulture, plant path, engineering, and remote sensing) to join us either in person (as conditions allow) or remotely on the below projects that you can read more about HERE or at the below link:  

  1. Lights, pathogens, action! Hyperspectral sensors for early disease detection
  2. Jet Pathogen Laboratory: Vineyard Disease detection with NASA sensors
  3. PhytoPatholoBot: the robotic scout of the future!
  4. Hitchhikers beware: monitoring for soilborne pathogen transport on global dust currents   https://scholars.pppmb.cals.cornell.edu/plant-pathology-and-plant-microbe-biology-research-projects/   (scroll all the way to the bottom)

Hannah Kerner (hkerner@umd.edu)
2021-01-07 11:29:28

Extended Outlook Crop Monitor Postdoctoral Researcher

The University of Maryland (UMD) Earth System Science Interdisciplinary Center (ESSIC) and the NASA Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET) team are searching for a researcher to contribute to the development of an extended outlook crop monitor (EOCM). The EOCM is expected to provide multi-seasonal forecasts (18- to 24-month lead time) of crop conditions and yields.   The position description is written to attract candidates with both physical hydrologic modeling and ML/AI backgrounds.  However, if we get a candidate with a strong ML/AI background (and we’re hoping that we do), we will go with that approach for the work. The advertisement is for a post doc, but we do have some flexibility to take on a candidate with more experience. However, this is not a tenure-track position.   

Please see the advertisement on the UMD ESSIC website for additional information: http://essic.umd.edu/joom2/index.php/employment/3058-extended-outlook-crop-monitor-postdoctoral-researcher

Earth System Science Interdisciplinary Center
Extended Outlook Crop Monitor Postdoctoral Researcher
The Earth System Science Interdisciplinary Center is a joint center between the University of Maryland departments of Atmospheric &amp; Oceanic Science, Geology, Geography and the Earth Sciences Directorate at the NASA/Goddard Space Flight Center.
Original URL: http://essic.umd.edu/joom2/index.php/employment/3058-extended-outlook-crop-monitor-postdoctoral-researcher

Sara Beery (sbeery@caltech.edu)
2021-01-25 18:07:19

Stanford Data Science is excited to invite undergraduate (currently enrolled seniors and juniors) and graduate (Masters) students enrolled at any accredited university in the United States to apply for the 2021 Data Science for Social Good Summer Fellowship. Apply here by Monday, February 15 at 11:59pm PT!The fellowship’s primary goal is to create a unique, world-class data science learning experience for student fellows while making progress on real-world problems with social impact. Stanford Data Science has solicited applications from project partners with social good oriented problems who need data science help. Participants will be mentored on their projects by faculty and advanced graduate students or post-docs. Each team will work closely with their mentors, meeting on a daily basis, and collaborating with their team members. The program will also include technical training and discussions on project-related and data science topics. Read about last year's program here.For additional information, please see the Call for Fellows. Please contact ds4socialgood@stanford.edu with any questions. If you’d like to receive updates about the program, you can subscribe to our mailing list.Please share this call with anyone you think might be interested.

😎 Jon Van Oast, Hannah Yin
Lily Xu (lily_xu@g.harvard.edu)
2021-01-27 09:44:47

PhD opportunity at Imperial College London in global adoption of forest restoration initiatives in the context of climate change

> Funded PhD studentship at Imperial College London in partnership with Conservation International. The studentship starts in October 2021 and the last date for application is February 26th 2021. > Application details: https://www.imperial.ac.uk/study/pg/apply/how-to-apply/ >   > Project summary: Countries around the world have committed to large scale planting of trees to help mitigate climate change impacts. However, the extent to which these are likely to be achieved and the impact of these large-scale restoration initiatives are yet to be predicted. Participants in forest restoration initiatives experience both costs and benefits associated with restoration activities. While approaches to make restoration more attractive have been suggested, there is little guidance of what approaches work in different socio-ecological systems. There have been numerous successful initiatives focused on restoring forest and planting trees around the world, for example the Nepal Community Forestry Program that involved approximately 19,000 community forestry groups and the participation of approximately 35% of the population and the Green Belt movement which empowered women and resulted in 51 million trees being planted in Kenya. There has also been large scale restoration of forest as a result of the abandonment of land as a result of rural to urban migration. While multiple theories explain why people engage in different pro-environmental practices and inform opportunities and constraints in implementing conservation or restoration initiatives, a landholder’s engagement with passive or active restoration still needs to be explored. This project seeks to understand and explain the pattern of adoption of restoration initiatives around the world. This project combines quantitative and qualitative research techniques to understand and explain patterns of spread of tree planting interventions. The project has the following phases: (1) synthesis of literature/development of theory describing the drivers of active and passive restoration, (2) description of existing patterns of adoption or restoration initiatives based on existing data, (3) a qualitative understanding of the processes driving the adoption of restoration initiatives and (4) testing hypotheses that explain the adoption of restoration initiatives using spatial-temporal modelling. This project will allow us to identify context-specific factors that shape spatial patterns and temporal trends of adoption of restoration initiatives, so that they can be designed to be more rapidly adopted and have positive impacts for people and nature.

Imperial College London
How to apply
Whether you're applying for a Master's course or a research programme, you must apply using our online system.
Original URL: https://www.imperial.ac.uk/study/pg/apply/how-to-apply/

2021-02-02 10:32:20

*Thread Reply:* Open to all ideas. Digital annotation can be a tough job, someone with good determination and interested in learning natural history. Ad was University of Florida: The Weecology Lab is looking for a technician to assist in image-based biodiversity surveys of everglades wading bird colonies and airborne forestry surveys. The technician will identify and quantify wading bird species and behaviors in aerial imagery, manage large imagery datasets, and assist the project manager. Ideal candidates will be able to work effectively remotely. Basic knowledge of bird biology and wading bird identification and/or tree identification are beneficial as is previous experience working with imagery such as camera trap or drone data and associated software (e.g., Zooniverse, Agisoft Photoscan, Adobe, Photoshop, Image J). The position will last at least for the Spring 2021 semester. The technician will receive $15/hr + benefits if working over 30 hours a week. Remote work is supported; computer and other home office equipment will be provided, as needed. Or working space at our lab on the UF campus is available, if desired. The technician will be invited to participate in weekly lab meetings (currently running remotely) and other professional development activities. Interested applicants should contact Dr. Glenda Yenni (<a href="mailto:gmyenni@ufl.edu">gmyenni@ufl.edu</a>) by February 5. Please include, in a single email attachment with the filename Yourlastname_app, 1) a short summary of your current research interests and why you are interested in this position (400 words or less) and 2) a description of prior work and/or research experience and the responsibilities, skills, and duties involved in those positions. Feel free to contact via email with any questions. Posted: 1/28/21.

Carly Batist (cbatist@gradcenter.cuny.edu)
2021-02-05 09:09:24

From a Bioacoustics listserv-- Full-time position in signal-processing/acoustics/software-engineering starting May or June 2021. Individual is responsible for developing and implementing a novel approach for locating objects in water using state-of-the-art technologies in signal processing and acoustics. Masters or PhD preferred but will consider undergraduate degree. Some of the topics being addressed involve beamforming, time-series analysis, and sequential estimation. Significant experience is required with the MATLAB programming language with proficiency desired in a C language. Experience in developing working software preferred. Excellent environment for individual interested in innovative approaches for novel problems. Health and retirement benefits are provided. Work takes place in area of Wayne, Pennsylvania. US citizenship required. Position contingent on contract award from the US government.

Application should include cover letter, resume, and three references. Please apply to john@scientificinnov.com.

John Spiesberger Earth and Environmental Science, U. Pennsylvania and Scientific Innovations Inc. john@scientificinnov.com scientificinnov.com

👍 Armin Bazarjani
Armin Bazarjani (bazarjan@usc.edu)
2021-02-05 17:18:58

Pachama is a startup in SF who are trying to combat deforestation and climate change. Their main idea is to create a marketplace where companies can support carbon offset projects. In a sense, they are trying to harness the power and efficiency of commercial markets to address climate change at scale.

Quote from Pachama: "Pachama is on a mission to solve climate change by restoring forests, nature's carbon sinks. Pachama harnesses satellite imaging with artificial intelligence to measure carbon captured in forests. This technology enables modernization of old carbon markets by providing new transparency and assurance to carbon buyers world wide. Every project we offer on the Pachama platform is validated using our remote technology to ensure you are supporting credible carbon projects."

They have some openings, might be worth looking into.

pachama.com
Pachama - Remove carbon. Restore forests.
Harnessing AI to drive carbon capture and protect global forests
Original URL: https://pachama.com/
jobs.lever.co
Pachama
Job openings at Pachama
Original URL: https://jobs.lever.co/pachama

Hannah Kerner (hkerner@umd.edu)
2021-02-10 09:24:25

We are looking for a machine learning engineer/researcher to join our team at University of Maryland to work on ML applications for food security + remote sensing as part of the NASA Harvest and SERVIR programs. See description and qualifications here: https://ejobs.umd.edu/postings/80972 Remote work is a possibility. Let me know if anyone has interest or questions!

ejobs.umd.edu
Faculty Specialist
The successful candidate will work on research, software development and streamlining work-flows related to machine learning applications for crop production forecasting for smallholder agricultural systems at the field to national scales with focus on Sub-saharan Africa. Example projects will involve developing machine learning models to map cropland and crop types from images, identify crop field boundaries, forecast crop yields, and alert of impending production shortfalls. These methods will be used to inform key agricultural and food security decisions as well as develop training materials for a range of public and private stakeholders. This research will be carried out through the use of a wide range of satellite data, unique ground-collected datasets, global archives of diverse socio-economic data, and statistics.
Original URL: https://ejobs.umd.edu/postings/80972

Daniel Grzenda (grzenda@uchicago.edu)
2021-02-15 17:01:48

Hi everyone, we are looking to recruit a software engineer to join our team at the University of Chicago working with our partners at the 11th Hour Project and Schmidt Family Foundation. Please share this opportunity with your networks, and reach out if you are interested!

The Data Science Initiative at the University of Chicago was established to support the development of emerging efforts in data science across the University. A core piece of the mission of the DSI is to support the work of social impact organizations. Together with our partners at the 11th Hour Project and Schmidt Family Foundation we work with social impact organizations across the domains of energy, food and agriculture, human rights, and marine technology. The Software Engineer will work closely with our growing team to support grantees by designing technical solutions, leading groups of students in developing maintainable projects, and deploying these applications in production.

https://uchicago.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/External/job/Illinois/Software-Engineer_JR10120

uchicago.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com
Software Engineer
Department  PSD Data Science About the Department  The Data Science Institute at the University of Chicago was established to support the development of emerging efforts in data science across the University. The staff in the Data Science Institute support the University’s community of scholars, their shared ideals, and the core values that make the University a singular intellectual destination. Together with the University's deans and department chairs, the Data Science Institute provides the opportunities, infrastructure, and resources that encourage our faculty and other scholars to pursue their finest work. Job Summary  The UChicago and the Data Science Initiatives are looking for an outstanding candidate with expertise in software engineering, and, ideally, a demonstrated ability applying skills to solve problems at the intersection of data science and social and environmental sciences. Aimed at candidates whose passion lies in developing innovative solutions to real-world data science problems in multiple domains, this position offers the opportunity to lead data science projects applied to social impact domains. Working in collaboration with UChicago Data Science Initiatives, the Data Science program faculty, and The Schmidt Family Foundation 11th Hour Project (“11th Hour”), the 11th Hour Software Engineer (SE) will support the data capacity of 11th Hour Project’s grantees. The Software Engineer will perform a variety of activities related to software support and/or development: the engineer will provide analysis, design, development, debugging, and modification of computer code for end user applications, beta general releases, web pages, and production support. In addition, the SE will be responsible for developing and architecting an open data platform, contributing to open source software, mentoring of student data science teams, and other activities designed to increase the data capacity of 11th Hour grantees. Responsibilities Architecture and Design - participates in the definition and documentation of requirements and architecture and design of complex systems based on knowledge of relevant software technologies being developed and/or used in commercial and scientific communities. Software Development - prototypes, develops, tests, code reviews, documents, deploys and maintains high-quality software, including web applications, REST interfaces, command-line interfaces, and other client applications. Team Coordination - engages proactively with other team members, both within the functional area and in other areas to design, develop and deliver quality products. Participates in team coordination and development activities, including project planning, project reporting, and recruitment. Mentor student teams through the development process of a data-focused applications Professional Development - Maintains a working knowledge of relevant software technologies. Supports and maintains existing applications. Works with web developers and responds to requests from users. Performs code testing on components and works to ensure that appropriate implementation standards are met. Evaluates design alternatives for development cost and solutions using various methods. Performs other related work as needed. Minimum Qualifications   Education:Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field. --- Work Experience:Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 2-5 years of work experience in a related job discipline. --- Certifications: --- Preferred Qualifications Education: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering or related field. Experience: At least 4 years of relevant programming experience developing, implementing, debugging, and maintaining applications with Python. Background in building web applications and APIs that power them. An interest in and experience writing software to support data-driven applications Technical Skills or Knowledge: Distributed version control system (e.g., Git). Linux. SQL databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, SQLite). Background with containers and infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform). Web technologies (e.g. REST, HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX). Agile (e.g. Scrum) development processes. Cloud Computing (e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Unit and integration testing tools (e.g. pytest, Jenkins, Github Actions, TravisCI). HTTP servers (e.g. Apache, NGINX). Experience contributing to an open source project. Working knowledge of shell scripting (e.g., Bash). Preferred Competencies Work in a collaborative team environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Problem solving skills. Comfortable using standard software development applications and tools. Prioritize and manage workload to meet critical project milestones and deadlines. Attention to detail. Confidentiality related to sensitive University matters such as, strategic initiatives, trade secrets, quiet periods, and scientific discoveries yet to be put in the public domain. Accomplished with full software design life cycle. Effectively articulate technical concepts, challenges and solutions, and engage proactively with team members. Experience managing project requirements using Agile methods Cloud infrastructure certifications Application Documents Cover letter (required) Resume/CV (required) When applying, the document(s) MUST be uploaded via the My Experience page, in the section titled Resume/CV of the application. Job Family  Information Technology Role Impact  Individual Contributor FLSA Status  Exempt Pay Frequency  Monthly Scheduled Weekly Hours  37.5 Benefits Eligible  Yes Drug Test Required  No Health Screen Required  No Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required  No Posting Statement   The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.   Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.   We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.   All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history.  A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment.  Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.   The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: <http://securityreport.uchicago.edu>. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

Vienna Saccomanno (v.r.saccomanno@tnc.org)
2021-03-09 15:28:40

The Nature Conservancy is conducting an early exploration of the potential for use of very high resolution (VHR) satellite imagery as a tool to survey large whales to meet conservation monitoring objectives. If the Project Description below catches your eye - or that of a colleague - please DM me for more information on how to apply or with questions. Please share this opportunity with your colleagues.

• Project Description: As part of this effort, we are seeking short-term contract support to develop an imagery acquisition cost assessment based on a geospatial analysis to determine potential imagery requirements for a specific use case off Northern California. With guidance from TNC staff, the contractor will develop 4-5 options for a potential Satellite Survey Area (SSA) in the region of interest, and based on imagery acquisition costs associated with up to 5 satellite options, produce a range of cost estimates based on survey design alternatives and satellite alternatives.  • Required skills: Geospatial analysis and database skills and satellite imagery experience required (e.g. ArcGIS, QGIS, R, Git). Wildlife survey design and/or wildlife detection using AI experience preferred. TNC team can arrange for 1-2 calls with a marine mammal survey expert familiar with the use case and will provide geospatial data and access to satellite imagery acquisition unit prices for select satellite options. • Target deliverable: 5-8 page cost assessment recommendation memo to TNC, covering the following: methods, relevant supporting literature, key advantages and limitations for each SSA design option and satellite alternative considered, and a recommendation on a SSA design option and satellite to optimize for cost-effectiveness and achieving conservation goals. Deliverable to also include associated maps for SSA design options and cost analysis data. • Target delivery date: April 23, 2021 • Maximum proposal amount: $10,000

👍 Jon Van Oast, Rosho

Ben Weinstein (benweinstein2010@gmail.com)
2021-04-09 12:38:45

ecolog this morning Doctoral Position between UBC-LFS and CLS. The successful candidate will be supported by a Mitacs Accelerate Fellowship and their 4-year research project is expected to start in Fall 2021 (September-December). The successful candidate will have the opportunity to contribute their own ideas and to help in finalizing the Mitacs Accelarate Fellowship application (anticipated submission deadline June 30th). The candidate will join the Faculty of Land and Food Systems (UBC-LFS) under supervision of Dr. Thorsten Knipfer and will be co-supervised by Drs. Devin Rippner (USDA-ARS) and Jarvis Stobbs (CLS).

We are looking for a student that is highly motivated to elucidate novel mechanism of how plants cope with water stress by drought. The project will integrate traditional plant water relations with cutting-edge imaging techniques. The student is expected to develop a user-friendly machine-learning tool kit to facilitate high-throughput image analysis and processing. We are seeking a student that has a strong interest in plant biology and agriculture; background with coding and python; experience with machine-learning; and is excited about multidisciplinary research. For more details see â€˜Project descriptionâ€™. We offer excellent research facilities at UBC-LFS and CLS (X-ray tomography imaging, machine-learning, image processing) and interdisciplinary scientific training in an international environment.

Qualified candidates holding or expecting to complete their MSc in biology, physics, engineering, or related fields in 2021 are encouraged to apply.

2021-09-11 16:13:39

Postdoc at Harvard Center for Research on Computation and Society, conservation is an interest area: https://academicpositions.harvard.edu/postings/10607

academicpositions.harvard.edu
Postdoctoral Fellowship at Harvard Center for Research on Computation and Society (CRCS)
The Harvard Center for Research on Computation and Society (CRCS) solicits applications for postdoctoral fellows for the 2022-2023 academic year. CRCS provides postdoctoral fellows with an annual salary plus travel and research funding to allow them to engage in independent research. Fellows spend up to two years at CRCS. We seek researchers who are enthusiastic about interacting with computer scientists and colleagues from other disciplines and who have a demonstrated interest in connecting their research agenda with societal issues. Areas of specific research interest for the 2022-2023 academic year include conservation and population health. Research in this arena may involve, among myriad other possibilities, the use of AI for protecting endangered wildlife, fisheries, and forests; the use of technology to detect and prevent disease; public health challenges amongst those experiencing homelessness, pandemic prevention, or strategies to promote health equity; and ethics and fairness in the application of technological innovation to societal problems. Privacy and security are topics that continue to remain of interest to CRCS. Many of these topics involve interdisciplinary collaboration. To that end, CRCS researchers have collaborated in interdisciplinary work with other centers at Harvard, including the Center for Communicable Disease Dynamics (CCDD), Edmund J. Safra Center for Ethics, Embedded EthiCS at Harvard, and the Harvard Chan India Research Center.  The ideal CRCS researcher will have a technical background in an area related to computer science and a desire to creatively use those skills to address problems of societal importance. CRCS is a highly collaborative environment, and we expect fellows to engage with researchers both inside and outside of computer science. CRCS researchers have made contributions to important outcomes such as the development of PAWS for conservation and the Privacy Tools Project.CRCS offers postdoctoral fellows numerous opportunities to engage with Harvard faculty, students, and scholars in computer science and other disciplines, including the CRCS lunch seminar series, professional development panels, informal CRCS lunches, and other research group meetings. Fellows will earn an annual salary of $75,000, paid monthly ,with additional support for research and conference travel.Harvard University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We are particularly interested in attracting women and underrepresented groups to participate in CRCS.For further information about the Center and its activities, see <https://crcs.seas.harvard.edu/.We> encourage candidates to apply by December 1, 2021, but will continue to review applications until the positions are filled.
Original URL: https://academicpositions.harvard.edu/postings/10607

Posting on behalf of Audacity’s Permacolony Initiative. Really great initiative with really creative, wholesome people. Application for startups will close on 31 September 2021. DM for more details.

This year, we are looking for Singapore-based startups who have: • A regional/global focus with the potential to make a strong impact on the future of humanity • Identify with one or more six themes of focus (more about the themes here)  • An MVP/prototype   We are keeping the program free. Throughout the program, startups can expect to get: • Support from notable mentors, investors and seasoned entrepreneurs • Physical and virtual test-bedding locations at Jurong Innovation District, Singapore’s largest living lab for innovation, and other partner locations.  • Investment opportunities with Mistletoe

Unlearn. Unlock. Unleash...
Permacolony
A bootcamp for radical startups who recognise the urgent need to advance the way we live.
Original URL: https://audacity.world/permacolony/

We run data challenges with a social impact, and do data consulting work as well. If you’re a motivated data scientist with a background in Python, come join us join us!

We’ve got a track record of engaging on conservation work including competitions (see here, here, and here), open source work, and building applications.

*Thread Reply:* Also programs like https://www.dssgfellowship.org/

Data Science for Social Good
Data Science for Social Good Summer Fellowship - Carnegie Mellon University
DSSG is a full-time summer program to train aspiring data scientists to work on machine learning, data science, and AI projects with social impact in a fair and equitable manner. Working closely with governments and nonprofits, fellows take on real-world problems in education, health, criminal justice, sustainability, public safety, workforce development, human services, transportation, economic development, international development.
Original URL: https://www.dssgfellowship.org/

2022-01-13 15:54:32

*Thread Reply:* In belated response to Sara: yes, we do indeed have one stipended summer fellow position this coming summer at the San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance Conservation Technology Lab. The link I am pasting in is for our whole institute. The specifics of what we are looking for are in the "Population Sustainability" section. Anybody doing CV/ML or other conservation-focused AI/ML (or many adjacent practices) would be a good candidate.

https://science.sandiegozoo.org/opportunities/summer-student-fellowships

San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance
Summer Student Fellowships
San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance offers Undergraduate Summer Student Fellowships in our Conservation Science teams: Recovery Ecology, Population Sustainability, Community Engagement, Conservation Genetics, Plant Conservation, Reproductive Sciences, and Disease Investigations.Applications for the 2022 Summer Conservation Science Fellowships can be submitted until February 4, 2022. Applicants should specify which team’s fellowship they are applying for; applicants can only apply for one team, not multiple teams.
Original URL: https://science.sandiegozoo.org/opportunities/summer-student-fellowships

2021-11-11 15:02:25

@Ian Ingram has joined the channel

Sara Beery (sbeery@caltech.edu)
2021-11-19 23:04:42

Two open Postdoc Positions at Yale in Image-based techniques for Environmental/Ecological Science Applications

We are seeking candidates who are comfortable working with image-based approaches (both traditional and ML-based) who would be interested in working on a variety of projects in Environmental/Ecological Science. Postdocs will be primarily advised by faculty in Engineering and Computer Science (Aaron Dollar, (Mechanical Engineering/Computer Science) and Holly Rushmeier (Computer Science)) and will collaborate closely with researchers in Environmental/Ecological Science also at Yale. Two preliminary directions/positions have been identified - 1) Automated phenotyping from Herbarium collections to examine correlations with climate effects, past and present (Dollar), and 2) Texture-based methods for richer suites of information about content contained in images such as camera traps and satellite imagery. Projects are fairly open-ended currently, and we expect candidates to play a leading role in fleshing out the details as well as exploring additional projects/collaborations. We also have an active volunteer student group (undergrads and grads) mostly from CS backgrounds ("Tech for Conservation") who are eager to work on these kinds of projects, and there will be ample opportunity for developing and supervising those students for your primary work and additional side projects.

The Fellowships are supported through the Hutchinson Fellowship program: https://yibs.yale.edu/hutchinson-fellows

Interested applicants should reach out to Aaron Dollar (aaron.dollar@yale.edu) and Holly Rushmeier (holly.rushmeier@yale.edu) with a CV and brief description of your interests/background in this application domain.

Institute for Biospheric Studies
G. Evelyn Hutchinson Environmental Postdoctoral Fellowship
The Hutchinson Environmental Program, named in honor of G. Evelyn Hutchinson, the father of modern ecology, supports the environmental priorities identified in Yale's strategy to advance the sciences. The program aims to enable creative collaborative research in the environmental sciences at Yale by facilitating the development of diverse academic excellence at the postdoctoral level.
Original URL: https://yibs.yale.edu/hutchinson-fellows

OC (boulaisoceane@gmail.com)
2021-12-02 18:27:46

NOAA has a few open positions that might interest the group.

AI/ML Architect Position UCAR seeks an AI/ML Architect to support NOAA Ocean Exploration.  NOAA Ocean Exploration explores unknown or poorly understood areas of our deep ocean, making discoveries of scientific, economic, and cultural value. Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and the cloud offer exciting, and potentially disruptive, opportunities to improve OER’s data and workflows. The incumbent will facilitate and accelerate implementation of advanced AI and Cloud solutions to improve the office data acquisition, analysis and dissemination. The incumbent will work closely with the Expeditions and Exploration Division of NOAA Ocean Exploration to develop a road map for AI and cloud technology implementation within the office.

ucar.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com
AI/ML Architect
Location: The anticipated location for this position will be the Silver Spring Metro Center Building #3 in Silver Spring, MD. Fully remote work from a location in the United States is also available for this position. Type: Full time, exempt. Position Term: One-year term. Application Deadline: This position will be posted until sufficient number of applications is received. Relocation: Partial relocation assistance is available for this position. Work Authorization: UCAR/NCAR will not sponsor a work visa to fill this position. Salary: Hiring Range $100,326 - $125,407 Full Salary Range $100,326 - $163,030 Benefits: UCAR affirms its continuing commitment to developing, providing, and administering its employee benefit programs with due consideration for equal employment opportunity and diversity guidelines. UCAR's rich package of employee benefits includes medical, dental, vision, education assistance, retirement, and life insurance. UCAR offers a variety of programs designed to assist with work-life balance including flexible work alternatives, paid time off and 14 weeks of paid parental leave. As required by Executive Order 14042, all Federal Contractor employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee’s duty location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. Effective immediately, UCAR requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated prior to entering on duty, subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected, you will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination by December 21, 2021 or before appointment or onboarding with UCAR, if after December 21, 2021. UCAR will provide additional information regarding what information or documentation will be needed and how you can request of UCAR a legally required exception from this requirement. Where You Will Work: Who we are: The Cooperative Programs for the Advancement of Earth System Science (CPAESS) serves the Earth system science community in three distinct areas of service. We partner with federal agencies and businesses to hire critical scientific staff enabling a more robust workforce. Through our scientific programs we seek to edify new research with our postdoctoral programs, our visiting scientist and internship programs, along with our interagency support programs. We also help build the Earth system science community by convening and managing summer schools and institutes, conferences, and advisory committees. What You Will Do: This position will develop a road map for NOAA’s Office of Ocean Exploration (OER) to implement use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)/cloud in OER’s datasets and data workflow. NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration (<https://oceanexplorer.noaa.gov/about/welcome.html#>) explores unknown or poorly known areas of our deep ocean, making discoveries of scientific, economic, and cultural value. To better understand our ocean, our office makes exploration data available to the public. This allows us, collectively, to more effectively maintain ocean health, sustainably manage our marine resources, accelerate our national economy, and build a better appreciation of the value and importance of the ocean in our everyday lives. Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and the cloud may offer exciting, efficient and cost-effective solutions to improve OER’s data and workflows. The incumbent will facilitate and accelerate implementation of advanced AI and Cloud solutions to improve the office data acquisition, analysis and dissemination. The incumbent will work closely with the Expeditions and Exploration Division of NOAA’s Office of Ocean Exploration to develop a road map for AI and cloud technology implementation within the office. The detailed road map will be used for current and future AI/Cloud applications and will impact OERs decisions for future investments. This position will be located at the Silver Spring Metro Center Building #3 in Silver Spring, MD.  Responsibilities:  Develop a technology roadmap for OER over the next year enabling AI/ML via cloud against any/all OER data where applicable: Serve as SME for development and review of current and future AI / Cloud projects at OER and advise about OER cloud architect / solutions Participate / Lead the OER Cloud Pilot project   Evaluate existing data collections and pathways Evaluate and identify cloud-based tools and solutions Evaluate and develop target areas for improved data collection and processing for machine learning/artificial intelligence Produce a scoping and feasibility document detailing: Preparing OER  to leverage AI/Machine Learning (ML) for data processing and utility improvements, including data integrity (QA/QC) and products that make analysis easier (such as annotations) Making OER data more prepared for AI/ML activities as they occur. Identifying  existing AI/ML technologies/algorithms could be leveraged now and determining how to implement these  KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES Certified, experienced Amazon Web Services (AWS) solution architect; with a focus on AI/ML, streaming data/video, and remote science/telepresence operations. AWS certified developer Proficient with Amazon Sagemaker [AWS's platform for ML/AI] <https://aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/> Skilled with AWS Data Analytics - mostly Kinesis (though S3, RedShift, and Elastic MapReduce also work). Experienced Python coder [baseline for AWS Recognition, sagemaker, and a host of AWS services] and Javascript NoSQL [non-relational] database experience: dynamodb, mongodb, etc. AWS Elemental [video workflow] skills, especially MediaConnect &amp; MediaConvert Network architecture Familiarization with cloud infrastructure, AI/ML, oceanographic data, big data problems/solutions, programming Ability to use statistical methods to evaluate the performance of Machine Learning models. Familiarity with high performance computing environments. Excellent communication skills in presenting technical research, and writing technical reports and proposals. Ability to work and communicate with an international and multidisciplinary team. Expert knowledge of multi-/many-core computer architectures, compilers, and supporting libraries. Awareness of recent developments in the area of computer architecture and high-performance computing. Advanced knowledge of performance programming paradigms for high performance systems. What You Need: EDUCATION &amp; EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Master’s degree in machine learning, computer science or a relevant field and a minimum of five years of Cloud/AI experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. DESIRED, BUT NOT REQUIRED: Experience working with NOAA datasets and archival workflows is desired, but not required. Experience working with deep ocean video and imagery data, especially imagery annotations, is highly desired but not required. Experience with telepresence, remote science, and/or live streaming video and data is highly desired, but not required. Familiarity with NOAA’s Cloud and AI strategy is highly desired, but not required. Applicant Notes: This position is subject to work location requirements for obtaining access to facilities and research systems. These requirements may include a combination of national security checks, credit checks, fingerprinting, or other security clearance or work authorization requirements. A pre-employment screening is conducted in conjunction with an offer for employment. This screening may involve verifying or reviewing any of the following relevant information: restricted parties screening, employment verification, performance records of internal candidates, education verification, reference checks, verification of professional licenses, certifications, and Motor Vehicle Records. UCAR complies with the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA). For more information about our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, here is the link t…
Original URL: https://ucar.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/UCAR_Careers/job/Foothills-Lab-4/AI-ML-Architect_REQ-2021-220-1

Katja Seltmann (seltmann@ccber.ucsb.edu)
2021-12-17 16:48:44

UC Santa Barbara's Cheadle Center for Biodiversity and Ecological Restoration is offering a HRAM.HRSAPPSCHJOB.GBL?Page=HRSAPP_JBPST&Action=U&FOCUS=Applicant&SiteId=31&JobOpeningId=28655&PostingSeq=1|Digital Imaging Assistant (Lab Assistant II) > position as part of the Big-Bee project (http://big-bee.net), a newly funded US National Science Foundation Advancing Digitization of Biodiversity Collections initiative to understand bee declines via specimen image digitization and trait analysis. Over the course of three years, we will create over one million high-resolution 2D and 3D images of bee specimens, representing over 5,000 worldwide bee species, including most of the major pollinating species. We will develop tools to measure bee traits from images and generate comprehensive bee trait and image datasets to measure changes through time. The Big-Bee network of participating institutions includes thirteen US institutions and partnerships with US government agencies. We will develop novel mechanisms for sharing image datasets and datasets of bee traits that will be available through an open, Symbiota data portal called the Bee Library. 

Reporting to the Director of the Cheadle Center for Biodiversity and Ecological Restoration at UC Santa Barbara, the Digital Imaging Assistant will collaborate closely with the Director to lead the digitization of bee specimens from natural history collections at UCSB via 3D and 2D imaging. They will help develop novel methods in imaging and anatomical trait measurement, including crowdsourcing measurements via the Notes From Nature community science platform. Applicants for this position are expected from various disciplines because of the cross-cutting nature of the work, and applicants from entomology, media arts, engineering, digital arts, biodiversity data science, museum curation, or related fields are welcome.

Job responsibilities include:

  1. implement imaging and processing workflows for 2D & 3D specimen imaging;
  2. evaluate results to determine scientific accuracy;
  3. organize, manage, and preserve digital files, including raw data, metadata, and derivatives;
  4. coordinate undergraduate imaging and research internships;
  5. create training and outreach materials in specimen imaging;
  6. assist in the overall coordination of the Big-Bee network;
  7. and perform other duties as assigned.

Preferred candidates will also demonstrate:

  1. knowledge of basic principles of photography;
  2. knowledge in insect morphology;
  3. knowledge about natural history collection databases, particularly Symbiota, and biodiversity data sharing;
  4. comfort with diverse software tools (Adobe) and online collaboration platforms (Google Documents, Slack, GitHub);
  5. writing and understanding of a scripting language (Python, R);
  6. the ability to meet a high level of production on a daily basis and work in a fast-paced, multi-project and dynamic environment;
  7. the ability to drive project completion on time and in a detailed manner, as well as self-motivation, intelligence, and strong work ethic;
  8. excellent organizational skills, good communication skills including writing and verbal;
  9. comfort with handling small delicate objects.

The person will join a research group focused on biodiversity data science and entomology. They will work closely with Cheadle Center for Biodiversity and Ecological Restoration Director, Dr. Katja Seltmann, who also has a background in media arts. The position is based at the University of California, Santa Barbara but includes cooperation with colleagues at other institutions. This is a full-time position (including full benefits) with a starting salary range between $20.14 - $21.31/hour. To HRAM.HRSAPPSCHJOB.GBL?Page=HRSAPP_JBPST&Action=U&FOCUS=Applicant&SiteId=31&JobOpeningId=28655&PostingSeq=1|apply for this position use the UCSB online application portal> Applications for the position will be reviewed starting January 16, 2022. Please send questions to seltmann@ucsb.edu

2022-02-09 13:25:05

Just learned that there will be no extra advertisement specific to the AI in the Biosciences jobs as I expected above. So, let me repeat: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

25 Lecturer/Senior Lecturer positions at Queen Mary University London, including in applications of AI in the biosciences https://www.qmul.ac.uk/jobs/vacancies/items/6618.html 

I’d like to call attention to the announcement here of 25 new academic positions by the Faculty of Science and Engineering at Queen Mary University of London.

To support a new MSc program at the School of Biological and Behavioural Sciences, we expect to appoint as part of this call Lecturers and/or Senior Lecturers who are pioneering applications of AI and big data analytics in the biosciences, including molecular and cellular biology, physiology, biomedicine, evolution, as well as basic and applied ecology at all scales. If you are working in one of these areas, please be encouraged to apply.

The application deadline is 13 March 2022.

Oisin Mac Aodha (macaodha@caltech.edu)
2022-03-09 06:46:56

Lecturer in Global Change Ecology at University of Manchester https://www.jobs.ac.uk/job/CNS277/lecturer-in-global-change-ecology

Applications are invited for a full-time Lecturer in Global Change Ecology. The appointee will deliver novel conceptual advances and/or mechanistic understanding of the responses of terrestrial species, communities and ecosystems to global change, and so contribute solutions to contemporary environmental problems, such as achieving net zero carbon emissions, climate change mitigation, the loss and protection of biodiversity, and land and biodiversity management for ecosystem services. They will help us achieve critical mass in this globally important area, creating new opportunities for inter-disciplinary collaboration within the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences and Manchester Environment Research Institute (https://www.meri.manchester.ac.uk), and more widely across the University and with external partners. We particularly encourage applicants with an interest in nature-based solutions to achieving NetZero.

Enquiries about the vacancy, shortlisting and interviews: Name: Susanne Shultz Email: susanne.shultz@manchester.ac.uk

Summer internship opportunity (US, remote) at the World Wildlife Fund (WWF) is looking for a Global Science Data and Technology intern to work at the intersection of geospatial data + data science for conservation

https://careers-wwfus.icims.com/jobs/3099/br-2224-global-science-data-and-technology-graduate-intern/job?mobile=false&width=1000&height=500&bga=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=-480&jun1offset=-420|https://careers-wwfus.icims.com/jobs/3099/br-2224-global-science-data-and-technology-gra[…]=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=-480&jun1offset=-420

Careers
BR-2224 Global Science Data and Technology Graduate Intern in Washington, Washington, DC | Careers at WWF US
WWF Overview For 60 years, WWF has worked to help people and nature thrive. As one of the world’s leading conservation organizations, WWF works in more than 100 countries, connecting cutting-edge conservation science with the collective power of our partners in the field – more than one million supporters in the United States and five million globally, as well as partnerships with communities, companies, and governments. Our vision for diversity, equity and inclusion at WWF is an organization as diverse as the world we protect; where the richness of all our unique views, experiences, and backgrounds combine to create the most sustainable and inclusive conservation outcomes possible — bringing the greatest benefit to the planet and every person who lives on it. Across the many cultures and individuals that represent WWF, we are unified by one mission, one brand, and one common set of values: Courage, Respect, Integrity and Collaboration. Internships at WWF WWF’s internship program vision is to recruit professionals early in their careers who bring fresh thinking and innovation to the environmental and conservation sector and are well positioned to develop into the next generation of leaders. Our mission is to increase exposure of students from underrepresented populations to conservation and environmental careers, provide professional development opportunities, reduce the barriers to attracting a diverse pool of internship candidates, and develop a pipeline for future WWF hires from underrepresented populations. Position Summary WWF seeks a Data and Technology intern who will work with the Global Science team to research the feasibility of a spatially explicit, regularly updated, habitat condition index.
Original URL: https://careers-wwfus.icims.com/jobs/3099/br-2224-global-science-data-and-technology-graduate-intern/job?mobile=false&amp;width=1000&amp;height=500&amp;bga=true&amp;needsRedirect=false&amp;jan1offset=-480&amp;jun1offset=-420

Yihang She (yihshe@student.ethz.ch)
2022-05-04 10:27:23

Hi people, I am looking for a research internship from May to September and would like to ask if anyone in the channel is interested in collaborations. I am currently a master’s student at ETH Zurich and will start my Ph.D. in Artificial Intelligence for Environmental Risks at Cambridge in September. As I have done my thesis, I am looking for a 3-5 months research internship before my Ph.D. study and will be able to start immediately. My research interests lie in object recognition, deep learning as well as their applications for environmental sustainability. My thesis studied fast few-shot object detection. Prior to that, I have also developed an algorithm classifying the photographs of plant species from citizen science projects. Besides few-shot learning, I also have hands-on experiences in fields such as meta-learning, domain adaptation, and remote sensing. Please do not hesitate to drop me a message if you are looking for research interns or just want to have a chat. I am currently based in Zurich and I am flexible with the working mode (on-site or remote). You can find my CV here.

Hi folks, really excited to share our search for an Executive Director for the newly launched Eric & Wendy Schmidt Center for Data Science & Environment (DS4E) here at UC Berkeley. Anticipated salary range of $149,000 to $161,000/year. The director of this center will play a major leadership role in shaping the direction of this center as it seeks to bring data science solutions to stakeholder-driven issues. The ED will help build and lead a team of project coordinators, Research Software Engineers and postdoctoral researchers. The center has a ~12M support with an initial runway of 4 years. Official application here: https://aprecruit.berkeley.edu/JPF03430 . Happy to field any questions.

Earth Species Project (ESP) is a nonprofit organization dedicated to decoding animal communication and transforming our relationships with each other and the rest of nature. We’re currently hiring for a Senior AI Research Scientist.

We are looking for people who have worked with artificial intelligence with a track record of delivering innovative research. They will join an incredible and global team and will be responsible for developing pioneering research towards decoding and translating non-human languages, including extending unsupervised translation techniques and tackling cornerstone biological and computational problems on large-scale multimodal behavioral data.

Blair Costelloe (blaircostelloe@gmail.com)

*Thread Reply:* GLUBS is a terrific acronym

Devis Tuia (devis.tuia@epfl.ch)
2022-08-15 09:56:07

> PhD Fellowships in Deep Learning for Remote Sensing and Ecosystem Modelling at University of Copenhagen > > The Machine Learning Section at the Department of Computer Science (DIKU) at the University of Copenhagen (UCPH) invites applicants for two fully-funded PhD fellowships in theory and application of deep learning for remote sensing data and predictive modelling of ecosystems. > > The first PhD will focus on novel deep learning algorithms for the analysis of satellite- and drone-based remote sensing data (images and 3D point clouds). The second PhD will focus on combining physical modelling, machine learning (in particular deep learning), and efficient computation for building models of ecosystems. > > The deadline for applications is September 1, 2022. Learn more and apply here: > > https://jobportal.ku.dk/phd/?show=157148 > > The PhDs will be linked to the projects DeReEco: Deep Learning and Remote Sensing for Unlocking Global Ecosystem Resource Dynamics (https://ai.ku.dk/research/research-projects/dereeco/) and Risk-assessment of Vector-borne Diseases Based on Deep Learning and Remote Sensing (https://novonordiskfonden.dk/en/news/research-in-denmark-will-protect-cities-in-africa-against-malaria-mosquitoes/). DIKU is part of the ELLIS Unit Copenhagen. The research will be conducted in collaboration with the Department of Geosciences and Natural Resource Management at UCPH.

jobportal.ku.dk
Two PhD Fellowships in Deep Learning for Remote Sensing and Ecosystem Modelling - 211-1177/22-2H
Original URL: https://jobportal.ku.dk/phd/?show=157148
ai.ku.dk
Deep Learning and Remote Sensing for Unlocking Global Ecosystem Resource Dynamics – University of Copenhagen
Homepage of the project&amp;nbsp;Deep Learning and Remote Sensing for Unlocking Global Ecosystem Resource Dynamics (DeReEco)&amp;nbsp;funded by The Villum Foundation.
Original URL: https://ai.ku.dk/research/research-projects/dereeco/
Novo Nordisk Fonden
Research in Denmark will protect cities in Africa against malaria mosquitoes - Novo Nordisk Fonden
A malaria mosquito native to Asia (Anopheles stephensi) is spreading in cities in Africa, where it transmits life-threatening parasites to the population. Further, this mosquito seems to thrive in the cities, where the population is growing rapidly, with the associated risk of major outbreaks of malaria. A grant of almost DKK 20 million from the Novo […]

My Site
Tech4Wildlife at Georgia Tech | Helping connect you to wildlife tech
Human-Wildlife Centered Design is the practice of understanding creating new ideas that help interface between humans and wildlife. At Tech4Wildlife at Georgia Tech, we work to use HWCD to help connect yellow jackets to conservation technology interventions.
Original URL: https://www.tech4wildlife.com/

Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute
MBARI is a unique oceanographic research center where scientists and engineers work together to develop new tools and methods for studying the ocean.

} Dr. Kakani Katija (https://twitter.com/KakaniKatija/status/1579915085408980993)
How do we scale observations of marine life to the scale of the #ocean?? Introducing <a href="https://twitter.com/OceanVisionAI">@OceanVisionAI</a>, a 2-yr $5M <b>#NSFfunded</b> program to tackle this challenge using <b>#AI</b> with <a href="https://twitter.com/MBARI_News">@MBARI_News</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/NOAANCEI">@NOAANCEI</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/CeNCOOS">@CeNCOOS</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/ucsc">@ucsc</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/OceanDiscLeague">@OceanDiscLeague</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/CVisionLLC">@CVisionLLC</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/ClimateChangeAI">@ClimateChangeAI</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/ioelephants">@ioelephants</a>. 🧵 1/ <https://twitter.com/OceanVisionAI/status/1579870087141392388>

Twitter
twitter
} Ocean Vision AI (https://twitter.com/OceanVisionAI/status/1579870087141392388)
Can <b>#ArtificialIntelligence</b> help protect the ocean? Ocean Vision AI is a new project that aims to accelerate the processing of and access to ocean video and imagery to enable effective marine stewardship. 🌊🤖 Learn more: <http://www.mbari.org/ocean-vision-ai-announcement>
Twitter
MBARI
Ocean Vision AI Program Manager
The OVAI program seeks to address the extraordinary challenge of scaling up our capacity to analyze underwater visual data through a globally integrated network that enables effective collaboration between human operators and artificial intelligence. OVAI’s platforms, which include a Portal, FathomNet, and Video Game, will achieve this through application of principles in data science, human-computer interaction, and community engagement. OVAI will accelerate ocean discovery, inform all sectors of the Blue Economy, and lead to effective and sustainable marine stewardship.
Written by
Cindy Hanrahan
Est. reading time
3 minutes
Original URL: https://www.mbari.org/ocean_vision_ai_program-manager/
MBARI
Ocean Vision AI Engagement Coordinator
The OVAI program seeks to address the extraordinary challenge of scaling up our capacity to analyze underwater visual data through a globally integrated network that enables effective collaboration between human operators and artificial intelligence. OVAI’s platforms, which include a Portal, FathomNet, and Video Game, will achieve this through application of principles in data science, human-computer interaction, and community engagement. OVAI will accelerate ocean discovery, inform all sectors of the Blue Economy, and lead to effective and sustainable marine stewardship.
